Title: Meta-analyses of clinical trials versus diagnostic test accuracy studies
Source: Diagnostic Meta-Analysis: A Useful Tool for Clinical Decision-Making
Abstract: © Springer International Publishing AG, part of Springer Nature 2018.In the present chapter, we discuss meta-analysis of clinical trials and compare them with meta-analysis of diagnostic accuracy studies. The former is based on the mixed effects model by DerSimonian and Laird (Control Clin Trials 7:177-188, 1986), and the latter is currently based on four main methods, with the most known bivariate model and the hierarchical summary receiver operator curve model. Each type of meta-analysis needs to be investigated for sources of heterogeneity. Specialist software exist to help each type of analysis.
